msgSnippet: On jumonji-yari made for the Hoso-in school school of fencing, they are required. Less common on straight yari, and should not be seen on straight Koto yari.

On jumonji-yari made for the Hoso-in school school of fencing, they are
required. Less common on straight yari, and should not be seen on straight
Koto yari. They are fairly common on Shinto ryo-shinogi (four sided) yari.

 

Gordon

 

-----Original Message-----
From: Richard Turner [mailto:ikkanshi@...] 
Sent: Friday, November 21, 2003 4:05 PM
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Yari tip

 

Thanks Gordon, I have never seen these on a yari before,  I learn something
new.

cheers

Rich
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Gordon Robson 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Friday, November 21, 2003 3:00 PM
  Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Yari tip


  It a yokote. It's not uncommon.

  Gordon

  On 2003.11.21, at 01:39  PM, Richard Turner wrote:

  > Hi all, this looks like a kissaki ( for want of a better word ) on 
  > this yari. I have not seen this before. Is there a name for it ?. Is 
  > this common ??
  > Rich
